intro: Ilex loranthoides, commonly known as the Indian holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy evergreen leaves and small, red berries that are produced in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have serrated margins, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
